title: Solving Quadratic Equations
description: Master multiple methods for solving quadratic equations: factoring, completing the square, and the quadratic formula.
subject: Mathematics
achievementDescription: Successfully solve quadratic equations using all major methods

text.introduction: Solving quadratic equations means finding the values of x that make ax² + bx + c = 0 true. These solutions are called roots or zeros, and they represent where the parabola crosses the x-axis. There are several methods to find these solutions, each with its own advantages.

sections.title: Factoring Method
sections.content:
**When to Use:** When the quadratic can be factored easily

**Steps:**
1. Set equation equal to zero: ax² + bx + c = 0
2. Factor the left side: (px + q)(rx + s) = 0
3. Use Zero Product Property: px + q = 0 or rx + s = 0
4. Solve each equation

**Example:** x² - 5x + 6 = 0
• Factor: (x - 2)(x - 3) = 0
• Solutions: x = 2 or x = 3

**Common Factoring Patterns:**
• x² - a² = (x - a)(x + a)
• x² + 2ax + a² = (x + a)²

sections.title: Completing the Square
sections.content:
**When to Use:** Always works, especially good for finding vertex form

**Steps:**
1. Move constant to right side
2. Complete the square on left side
3. Take square root of both sides
4. Solve for x

**Example:** x² + 6x - 7 = 0
• x² + 6x = 7
• x² + 6x + 9 = 7 + 9
• (x + 3)² = 16
• x + 3 = ±4
• x = -3 ± 4
• Solutions: x = 1 or x = -7

sections.title: The Quadratic Formula
sections.content:
**The Universal Method:** Works for ANY quadratic equation

**Formula:** x = [-b ± √(b² - 4ac)] / (2a)

Where ax² + bx + c = 0

**The Discriminant:** b² - 4ac
• If > 0: Two real solutions
• If = 0: One real solution (repeated root)
• If < 0: No real solutions

**Example:** 2x² - 7x + 3 = 0
• a = 2, b = -7, c = 3
• x = [7 ± √(49 - 24)] / 4
• x = [7 ± √25] / 4 = [7 ± 5] / 4
• Solutions: x = 3 or x = 1/2

sections.title: Choosing the Best Method
sections.content:
**Factoring:** Try first if coefficients are small integers
• Fast when it works
• Not always possible

**Completing the Square:** Good for understanding vertex form
• Shows the transformation clearly
• Useful in calculus and advanced topics

**Quadratic Formula:** The reliable backup
• Always works
• Essential for non-factorable equations
• Gives information about number of solutions

questions.question: Solve by factoring: x² - 9 = 0
questions.explanation: x² - 9 = (x - 3)(x + 3) = 0, so x = 3 or x = -3, written as x = ±3.

questions.question: For 3x² - 2x + 5 = 0, what does the discriminant tell us?

exercises.title: Mixed Solution Methods
exercises.instructions: Solve each equation using the most appropriate method, then verify with another method.
exercises.hint: Try factoring first, then use the quadratic formula if factoring doesn't work easily.

exercises.title: Ghana Real-World Applications
exercises.instructions: Set up and solve quadratic equations from real-world scenarios in Ghana.
exercises.hint: Look for situations involving area, projectile motion, or profit maximization.

scenarioChallenges.title: Ghana Agricultural Planning
scenarioChallenges.scenario: Farmer Kofi has 100 meters of fencing to create a rectangular vegetable garden against his house (so one side doesn't need fencing). He wants the garden to have an area of 1200 square meters. The area A of the rectangle is given by A = x(100 - 2x), where x is the width.
tasks: Set up the equation for the desired area
Solve the quadratic equation to find possible widths
Determine which solution makes practical sense
Calculate the dimensions of the optimal garden
learningObjectives: Apply quadratic equations to optimization problems
scenarioChallenges.ghanaContext: Agriculture is a major sector in Ghana's economy, and farmers often need to optimize land use and resource allocation for maximum productivity.

achievements.description: Solve the same equation using all three methods
